summary: A video featuring Quinny Eskimo (QE) sharing his knowledge on firewood and tinder selection, personal updates, and a fire-starting demonstration.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up view of a pile of cut logs, showcasing their rough, textured surfaces and varying shades of brown. A hand appears, gently touching and moving the logs, revealing their intricate details and the natural patterns of the wood. The camera then zooms out to provide a broader perspective of the pile, highlighting the logs' arrangement and the surrounding environment, which includes more logs and possibly a forested area. The hand continues to interact with the logs, emphasizing their texture and the natural beauty of the wood. The video concludes with a wider shot of the entire pile, capturing the logs' arrangement and the serene, natural setting.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker introducing himself as Fair Wight, Quinny Eskimo, describing that he is gathering cottonwood bark. He explains how he is shredding it up for use as tinder. The speaker mentions creating a previous video about tinder and expresses his intention to gather the cottonwood bark for later use. As the man continues speaking, there is the sound of material being moved or ripped apart, implying the handling of the bark. The sounds of handling the cottonwood material are heard.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person's hand interacting with a pile of chopped wood, which includes logs and branches. The hand is seen peeling back layers of bark and leaves to reveal the wood underneath. The wood appears to be freshly cut, with visible textures and patterns on the surface. The person's hand is wearing a red and black plaid shirt, and the background shows more wood and foliage, suggesting an outdoor setting, possibly a forest or a woodpile area. The hand's movements are deliberate, as it carefully examines the wood, possibly searching for something or inspecting the quality of the wood. The video captures the tactile interaction between the hand and the wood, highlighting the natural textures and the process of uncovering the wood beneath the bark and leaves.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker, discussing a "nice tender," adding that it "works pretty good." He mentions seeing something unplanned and not having his "stuff." The speaker then advises, "Keep your eyes open." Throughout, the speaker sounds conversational.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a pile of chopped wood, showcasing various sizes and textures of logs and branches. A person's hand, wearing a plaid shirt, is seen peeling off the bark from a piece of wood, revealing the lighter wood underneath. The person continues to peel the bark, showing the rough texture and the contrast between the bark and the wood. The background remains consistent, with more chopped wood visible, indicating an outdoor setting, possibly a woodpile or a lumber area. The video focuses on the action of peeling the bark, highlighting the natural process and the tactile interaction between the person's hand and the wood. The scene transitions to a close-up of a piece of wood with rough, textured bark, held by the same person wearing a plaid shirt. The person places the bark on a pile of chopped wood, which consists of various sizes and textures of logs and branches. The background remains consistent with the previous scene, indicating an outdoor setting, possibly a woodpile or a lumber area. The video emphasizes the natural process of peeling bark and the tactile interaction between the person's hand and the wood, showcasing the contrast between the bark and the wood underneath.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a single male voice, speaking in a conversational tone about being in the woods and having dry dead cottonwood, referring to a bushcraft video and the abundance of wood for a fire, specifically mentioning bark. The speaker notes the tinder and when dry, placing it on a campfire. He then describes this as a small tip bit. The sounds of rustling disrupt the male speaker who is seemingly peeling material off a tree.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a close-up view of a pile of chopped wood, with a person's hand interacting with the logs. The hand, wearing a plaid shirt, is seen touching and moving the wood pieces, revealing the texture and details of the bark and wood grain. The environment appears to be outdoors, with natural light illuminating the scene. The camera focuses on the hand's movements, highlighting the tactile interaction with the wood. The video captures the essence of handling and examining the chopped wood, emphasizing the natural and rustic setting.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker begins by advising someone to "keep your eyes open". He then describes the outside of the cedar tree as beautiful and says what they have is nice. He suggests using it as fuel and mentions that oak and maple bark can also be used. He concludes by calling the subject a bonus, stating that he will dry it out and will have some beautiful tinder.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a pile of chopped wood, showcasing the rough texture and various sizes of the logs. A hand appears, pointing at different parts of the wood, possibly indicating specific features or qualities. The camera then pans out to reveal a larger pile of wood, with a wheelbarrow filled with chopped wood in the foreground. The background includes a tarp-covered pile of wood, a white shed, and a grassy area, suggesting an outdoor setting, likely a backyard or a wood storage area. The video concludes with a wider shot of the entire scene, emphasizing the organized arrangement of the wood and the surrounding environment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with the sound of a chainsaw, suggesting an outdoor setting. A male speaker then comments on the wood they're cutting, mentioning it will burn once dry, and refers to having "lots of oak, some ash, maple." He indicates it's just the beginning and there's "a whole bunch there." The speaker states he just came over to "touch base" before the chainsaw resumes.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a pile of freshly cut logs, showcasing their rough, textured surfaces and the natural patterns of the wood. The camera then pans to reveal more logs, some with moss and lichen, indicating they have been exposed to the elements for some time. The scene transitions to a man standing outside a house, wearing a red and black checkered flannel shirt and a cap. He appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his facial expressions change. The background shows a white house with siding and a window, along with some trees and a clear sky, suggesting a calm, residential setting. The man continues to speak, occasionally looking around, possibly addressing someone off-camera or reflecting on the surroundings. The video maintains a consistent focus on the man and his surroundings, emphasizing the contrast between the natural elements of the logs and the man's casual, outdoor attire.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker sharing that he was in the hospital for four days to "get the heart tuned up a little bit." He mentions needing to pick up keys and suet from a hardware store and notes that he is showing the listener something outside. He comments that it's chilly and parts of the state are getting snow, even though it's "April 15th, 16th," then repeats that he had a good experience and gives praise to healthcare workers saying "they're saints." He indicates that everything feels good, as if his "heart is even keeled now," and promises to "keep kicking." He states that he feels fine, but wants to avoid pushing himself, and wants to show the listener the wood, after which the audio clip ends.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, an elderly man with a white beard and mustache is seen wearing a green cap and a red and black checkered jacket over a yellow and blue plaid shirt. He is standing in front of a pile of chopped wood, surrounded by trees and greenery, suggesting an outdoor setting, possibly in a forest or a backyard. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation, as indicated by his facial expressions and slight movements of his head and mouth. The background remains consistent throughout the video, with no significant changes in the environment or the man's position. The overall atmosphere is calm and natural, with the man seemingly sharing his thoughts or experiences related to the woodpile or the surrounding nature.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker mentioning, "I'm gonna have a lot more delivered here," and noting that they're "doing good". He admits not planning the activity, but felt compelled to get some "tinder, man" for his "haversack." The audio includes sounds of birds chirping, establishing a natural setting outdoors.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, an older man with a white beard and mustache is seen standing outdoors in a wooded area, surrounded by trees and a pile of chopped wood. He is wearing a green cap and a red and black checkered flannel shirt over a yellow and blue plaid shirt. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation, as he looks around and gestures with his hands. The background is filled with greenery, and the atmosphere is calm and natural. The man's facial expressions and body language suggest that he is actively participating in the discussion, possibly sharing his thoughts or experiences related to the environment or the woodpile. The video captures the essence of a serene outdoor setting, with the man's attire and surroundings reflecting a rustic and natural ambiance.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with someone stating they have "a lot to do" and have apple wood to start carving with. He mentions he got a bunch of it at the orchard and plans to "plant a tree or something, fruit tree". He says he will be working on that and "other stuff" and is "waiting to get out camping, you know". The speaker is male and speaks in a casual tone. Throughout this speech, various bird sounds are audible in the background, creating a natural, outdoor ambiance.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, an older man with a white beard and mustache is seen standing outdoors in a wooded area, wearing a red and black plaid flannel shirt over a yellow and blue plaid shirt, and a light green cap. He appears to be engaged in a conversation, as his facial expressions and mouth movements suggest he is speaking. The background features a pile of cut logs, evergreen trees, and a glimpse of a residential area with a house and a lawn. The man's attire and the setting suggest a casual, possibly rural environment. Throughout the video, the man's expressions and gestures indicate he is actively communicating, possibly sharing information or stories related to the surroundings. The scene remains consistent, with no significant changes in the environment or the man's position, maintaining a steady focus on his interaction.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker expressing relief about recent rain, stating, "We finally got rain, we needed rain big time." He mentions snowfall north of their location and then describes a recent local incident, stating that "they had a mountain lion hit by a car," noting the animal is still alive but its current location is unknown. The speaker suggests the state prefers to keep the incident quiet. No other sounds besides speech are present.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, an older man with a white beard and mustache is seen wearing a green plaid cap and a red and black plaid jacket over a yellow and blue plaid shirt. He is standing outdoors in a residential area, surrounded by a pile of chopped firewood. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation, as he looks around and gestures with his hands. The background features a house with a garage, a driveway, and a red chair on the lawn. The atmosphere is calm and serene, with trees and greenery adding to the peaceful setting. The man's expressions and movements suggest he is sharing stories or experiences related to the firewood or his surroundings.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a single male speaker identifying himself online as "Winnie Eskimo", mentioning his presence on Instagram, Odyssey, and Rumble under different usernames. He expresses gratitude for YouTube and mentions he is feeling fine. Following the speaker, ambient sounds are heard, with wind noises. Finally, the clip ends with the male speaker saying, "We're going up for thirst for tonight but it'll be good, man."

events_list.video_caption: The video features an older man with a white beard, wearing a plaid hat and a red and black checkered shirt, standing outdoors in a residential area. He is surrounded by a pile of chopped wood, with a house and a garage visible in the background. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation, as his facial expressions and mouth movements change throughout the video. The camera then shifts focus to the chopped wood, showing various sizes and shapes of logs, some of which are covered with a tarp. The environment is a mix of greenery and residential structures, creating a serene and rustic atmosphere. The video captures the man's interaction with the woodpile, highlighting the details of the logs and the surrounding area.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker expressing gratitude for healthcare workers, referring to them as "saints" after seeing them "in action". He speaks in a calm, reflective tone, mentioning that he needs to take care of himself. This is followed by a sound resembling rustling or moving objects, possibly indicative of shifting items.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a large pile of chopped firewood, with a brown tarp partially covering it. The firewood is stacked in an outdoor setting, surrounded by greenery and trees, indicating a natural environment. The camera pans over the pile, revealing the texture and variety of the wood, with some pieces showing bark and others appearing smooth. In the background, a house and a parked car are visible, suggesting a residential area. The video also captures a wheelbarrow filled with wood and a long-handled tool, possibly an axe, lying on the ground, indicating recent activity related to wood chopping or preparation. The overall atmosphere is one of a well-maintained outdoor space, with the firewood neatly stacked and ready for use.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with someone speaking about how "this stuff is already split" and saying that they are "going to be taking some of this." The speaker mentions doing a stack and also a truck is over there. There is a mention of rain. The speaker says that "they got plenty of wood down there." The speaker's tone is casual and informative. There is only one speaker, who is male. The clip contains sounds of someone speaking outdoors and the sound of rain.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a view of a large pile of chopped firewood in a yard, with a house and a car visible in the background. The camera then zooms in on the firewood, showing the different sizes and textures of the logs. The scene transitions to a close-up of a book titled "How to: Build a lean-to, Find wild food, Follow a trail, Use an axe, Hitch a mule, Survive outdoors" by Ellsworth Jaeger, which contains over 400 illustrations. The video then shifts to an older man wearing a red plaid jacket, who is working on a small project at a table outdoors. He is using a tool to carve or shape a piece of wood, surrounded by various tools and materials. The man appears focused on his task, with a calm and concentrated expression. The video concludes with the man continuing his work, with the background showing a fence and some vegetation, indicating an outdoor setting.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a single male speaker who is sharing his intentions to "grab some of that stuff at tender," "get some keys made" and "get a little suit." He speaks in a casual tone, encouraging someone to "keep kicking" and "keep moving." The speaker says goodbye. Next, there is the distinct sound of a lighter being sparked, then a brief pause, followed by the speaker acknowledging success, stating "There we go." The lighter-sparking sound is repeated.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, an elderly man with a white beard and wearing a red and black checkered jacket is seen outdoors, surrounded by a cluttered workspace filled with various tools and materials. He is meticulously working on a bundle of fibrous material, possibly preparing it for use. The man's hands are the focal point, as he carefully manipulates the fibers, occasionally bringing them close to his face to inspect them. The background reveals a rustic setting with bare trees, a fence, and a building, suggesting a rural or semi-rural environment. The sunlight casts shadows, highlighting the textures of the materials and the man's weathered hands. Throughout the video, the man's focused expression and deliberate movements convey a sense of concentration and skill in his craft.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with someone placing an object inside another, mentioning they're putting it "with this cotton" and adding other stuff too. A slightly higher sound begins, perhaps an adjustment or setting change. The speaker expresses optimism, stating "I think it's going to go pretty good", followed by the sound of something igniting or starting up. He notes that "charcoal works, tinder works" and expresses affirmative agreement. The tone shifts to amusement as he observes that "it looks pretty wild there".
